main event: Observers at Camp Carson sighted a silvery unidentified flying object at 0614 MST which was visible for 4 minutes before disappearing at a high rate of speed.
interesting points: The object was described as a luminous white light at an estimated altitude of 20,000 feet., The sighting took place two hours after a scheduled piball balloon release., Observers noted the object appeared to change directions and became tear-shaped during observation., The report tentatively suggests the object could possibly have been a balloon despite the unusual speed., No photographs were included with the report.
witness description: 1st LT John W. Cain, experienced observer
